Rule.NonCompliantComment: HTTP is not redirected to HTTPS, which exposes unencrypted traffic to interception.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure a 301 redirect from HTTP to HTTPS in the NGINX configuration.
Rule.Verification: curl -I http://localhost | grep -q '301 Moved Permanently' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: A self-signed or untrusted SSL certificate is used, which reduces trust.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install a trusted SSL certificate from a trusted Certificate Authority (CA).

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The private key has weak or improper permissions, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict the private key permissions to root only (600).

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Weak or deprecated SSL/TLS protocols are enabled, increasing vulnerability to attacks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict SSL/TLS protocols to TLS 1.2 and TLS 1.3 only.
Rule.Verification: nginx -T | grep -q 'ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3;' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Weak SSL/TLS ciphers are enabled, increasing the risk of exploitation.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable weak SSL/TLS ciphers in the configuration.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Custom Diffie-Hellman parameters are not used, reducing security.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Use custom Diffie-Hellman parameters for secure key exchange.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: OCSP stapling is not enabled, increasing SSL handshake time and reducing security.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable OCSP Stapling in the SSL configuration.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is not enabled, reducing HTTPS security.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable HSTS in the NGINX configuration.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Upstream server traffic is not authenticated with a client certificate, reducing security.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure client certificate authentication for upstream server traffic.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The upstream server certificate is not verified, making the server vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle attacks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure NGINX to verify the upstream server certificate using a trusted CA certificate.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Your domain is not preloaded in HSTS, reducing the effectiveness of HTTPS.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure HSTS with the preload directive and submit your domain for HSTS preload.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: SSL session resumption is enabled, reducing the benefits of Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS).
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable SSL session resumption for PFS.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: HTTP/2.0 is not enabled, which reduces the performance of HTTPS connections.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable HTTP/2.0 for HTTPS connections in NGINX.
Rule.Verification: nginx -T | grep -q 'listen 443 ssl http2;' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) ciphers are not enforced, reducing SSL/TLS security.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict SSL/TLS ciphers to only PFS-compatible ciphers (ECDHE).
